CADI.Common.Cache

Class DataBinStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • CADI.Common.Cache.DataBinStream

  • public class DataBinStream
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is designated to save an stream of bytes. It has basic operations to add new chunks of bytes, read bytes or chunks of bytes, and methods to set or read the pointer of the next byte to be read, skip a number of bytes or the check the number of remainder bytes.
    Version:
    1.0.3 2012/03/12
    Author:
    Group on Interactive Coding of Images (GICI)

    • Field Detail

      • chunks

        private java.util.ArrayList<byte[]> chunks
        One-dimensional array with the data of the data-bin.

      • length

        private long length
        Is the length of all chunks (data bin saved).

      • chunkPos

        private int chunkPos
        Is the index of the chunk.

      • chunkIndex

        private int chunkIndex
        Is the index of byte in the chunk pointed by chunkPos.

      • dataBinPos

        private long dataBinPos
        Is the position in the whole data bin.

        Its value is deduced from chunkIndex and chunkPos as: pos = offset(chunkIndex) + chunPos, where offset() is the offset of the chunk in the databin.

        Although it can be computed it is considered to reduce the cost of computing it value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataBinStream

        public DataBinStream()
        Constructor.

      • DataBinStream

        public DataBinStream(int numChunks)
        Constructor.

        It allows that an initial capacity, number of chunks, being set in order to improve the performance.

        Parameters:
        numChunks - initial capacity.

    • Method Detail

      • addData

        public void addData(byte[] data)
        Adds a new byte array to the stream.
        Parameters:
        data - byte array to be added.

      • addData

        public void addData(byte[] data,
           long offset)
        Adds a new byte array to the stream beginning at the offset position.

        Data to be added must be placed just after the previous data or overlapped, but not gaps/holes between the previous and new data are allowed.

        Parameters:
        data - byte array to be added.
        offset - position in which to add the data.

      • addStream

        public void addStream(byte[] data,
             long offset)
        Adds a new byte array to the stream beginning at the offset position.

        Data to be added must be placed just after the previous data or overlapped, but not gaps/holes between the previous and new data are allowed.

        Parameters:
        data - byte array to be added.
        offset - position in which to add the data.
